Reviews.Title: “Excellant location and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: ibaugh
Reviews.Content: As other reviews state, the Mosaic is close to just about everything you will want to see in Istanbul. I was with Gate-1 Travel, and stayed here at the beginning and end of our tour of Turkey. The room was spotless,the buffets excellent, and the front desk staff knew my first name. I do a lot of traveling every year and will stay here again when returning to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service and good location”
Reviews.Author: globeseeker007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as part of a tour group. The staff is friendly and helpful and the breakfast buffet and dinner are very good. The hotel is in a great location and there are restaurants and other places of business close by. On our last day there, we walked to the Grand Bazaar and it only took us about 15 minutes to get to the entrance. There are also ATMs within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: riverhawk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mosiac Hotel as part of a tour. We stayed two nights before and one night after our tour of Turkey. The location is excellent, the tram is a very short walk and is a great and inexpensive way to get around. The Blue Mosque is within walking distance and the grand bazaar is very close. We felt the location was very convenient for getting around the old town. There are many stores in the area to pick up things you may have forgotten or lost along the way. There are also many restaurants in the area that I was told by other members of my group were nice. The breakfast buffet was good, there was an egg station and a decent amount of choices. There is a well stocked lobby bar that is pricey but nice...we enjoyed a few drinks there. The first room we had was the dredded inward facing room that has a "window" to the ventilation shaft and was the tiniest room I had ever seen, but did have 1 large bed rather than 2 twins. The second time we had a much larger room with a window that opened to the outside. The beds were comfortable but had minimal pillows; just the 2 on the bed and no extra in the closet. The rooms were clean, the shower stall a bit awkward but overall a nice room. I felt the location was the most appealing aspect of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: FrugalFrannie
Reviews.Content: Stayed two different times on a Gate1 tour, March and April of this year. First time the room had a stained rug. Second time the room had a weirdly designed bathroom. You had to be in the shower stall or on the toilet to close the door. Front desk staff varied in attitude and helpfulness from nice to okay. Location is good for Hagia Sophia, et al.; it was about a 20 minute walk. The bar was actually the only one that gave us a bucket when we asked for ice. Normally, the other hotels on the tour offered just a cup of ice.

Reviews.Title: “Not for non-smokers”
Reviews.Author: Larryort
Reviews.Content: The only reason I don't rate it a 4 out of 5 is because they still haven't got the non-smoking thing down yet. The property itself is very nice. Possibly even 4 star nice if you try out their spa which includes the Turkish Bath. The spa's hours are wierd though. If guests enter before 6pm, it is free. Afterwards, there is a charge of $15 usd. The room decor seeks to copy the italian style. Ornate and a bit over the top. However, the bed was clean and comfortable, and the bathroom was big (I don't know about other rooms, but ours had only a shower with decent pressure). Our room on the 5th floor also had a balcony which afforded us a view of the Blue Mosque which was quite nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The restaurant is a challenge if you don't speak Turkish. Now about that smoking thing. We were on a "non-smoking" floor, yet the room reeked of smoke. I checked with others who traveled with us and they had the same issues. I know it's not as strict as the US, but if you have issues with smoke I would recommend you search elsewhere. All in all, it wasn't a bad place to stay. Just be prepared. We spent little time in the room, so it wasn't that big a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the old part of town”
Reviews.Author: KR46
Reviews.Content: did not get a very good room (window opened to an 8X8 chute that housed the a/c units); worst part was that one could not cool the room down by opening the window. Service was fine, food good. Convenient location for the Blue Mosque, Cisterns, Grand Bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly and very helpful staff. Great location for old town. 15-20 minute walk to Grand Bazaar and Blue Mosque. The hotel was very clean and the breakfast spread was very substantial. The bathroom was very small. The hotel has a very small swimming pool which guests are only able to use between 12-6pm.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel conveniently located in the heart of Istanbul and very close to the Grand Bazaar.”
Reviews.Author: AndrewTracey
Reviews.Content: The Mosaic Hotel is a comfortable hotel conveniently located in the heart of Istanbul and very close to the Grand Bazaar. My wife and I stayed here through a Gate 1 Travel trip for two nights at the start of our Turkey vacation and one night before we flew back home. It has a well-equipped gym and a largeTurkish bath, sauna, whirlpool and pool which is free of charge before 6 pm. Our first room was cozy but very small with two tiny single beds that were a little uncomfortable. On second stay we were given a huge room on the top floor with king size bed and million dollar view from the balcony. Free wireless Internet access was available in the rooms and the breakfasts were good with many hot and cold options.

Reviews.Title: “Great start and end to trip”
Reviews.Author: kmk58
Reviews.Content: Our room was small but very comfortable. Heat is by radiator and the room can get very warm. The desk clerk was very helpful in telling us how to turn it off and how the wall air conditioner worked. Our room was directly over the bar and the music was on for a good part of the evening, but was fun to listen to. No problem when it was time to sleep. Breakfast was great. Definitely try the "pancake" made by the woman towards the back of the restaurant. We were on our own the first day of our tour and everything was an easy walk from the hotel. On our last day we were walking past the istanbul fish and steak house up one corner from the hotel and met the most wonderful Turkish man (one of the restaurant owners). Even though we explained we had already eaten, he spoke with us for some time about our experiences in Turkey. Definitely check out his place, it should be fun!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: nishneel
Reviews.Content: It's a clean, well maintained hotel with good facilities like jacuzzi and turkish bath and a nice restaurant offering turkish cuisine. The rooms are pretty small can hardly accomodate a baby cot. The price is reasonable and it is close to most of the attractions and the tram station. It is 10 mins walk to grand bazar where one can get foods at reasonable price. The staff is friendly and maintain cleanliness in the room. Overall the room is good for a couple, not for a family if u all want to stay in one room

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: tinamf79
Reviews.Content: Stayed at as part of Gate 1 (Virgin Vacations) 13 day Turkish Treasures tour. This hotel is in a great location. About a 10min walk to the Grand Bazaar, 30mins to Blue Mosque, 20 mins to Galata Brige with wonderful sites to see along the way. There are a lot of Doviz (money exchangers) with great rates for either buying or selling located on the populated street, Ordu, on way to Blue Mosque or Grand Bazaar. Hotel lobby had nice modern dÃ©cor. The best part of the hotel is the view from the terrace! Pool looks nice, but we had too much to do in Istanbul and no time for the pool. The breakfast and buffet dinner was excellent, but same each day. Rooms also had modern dÃ©cor and were very clean. Since, the Gate 1 tour group we traveled with started and ended at this hotel, we were able to stay in two different rooms. The first room had 2 twin beds. The beds were hard and the sleeping arrangement was uncomfortable for a vacation as a married couple. The room was spacious though and the bathroom had a big bathtub. The shower was great. However, you can hear your neighborâ€™s above and below you through the bathroom ventilation. This room was located toward the front of the hotel and was very noisy. The hotel has a 24 hr restaurant which keeps the music going till 2am. The hotel should suggest the restaurant at least turn down the music at midnight so its guests who are trying to recover from jet lag can get some sleep! The second room had a soft for euro standards queen bed and although overall the room was smaller and had a stand-up shower only, it was much more comfortable for us as a married couple. Still the loud music could be heard until early morning. Overall, Iâ€™d recommend this hotel for location and best view from the terrace. If only, it wasnâ€™t so noisy it would have been perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: daxter11
Reviews.Content: This is one nice hotel. The rooms are outstanding. The food is turkish and very good. Hotel staff are friendly and very helpful. Train is a 6 minute walk downhill. Blue Mosque is 10 minutes away and the shopping bazaar is 5 minutes. Very safe area. Lots of places to eat in the area. Fantastic spa with indoor pool. You can get tea anytime of the day or night from anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “First rate hotel in the Sultanhamet neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: bkb38
Reviews.Content: Only spent a few days here on two seperate occassions but found the location excellent for exploring to the Blue Mosque, Sultanhamet, the Grand Bazaar and this more touristy peninsula of Istanbul. The breakfast was first rate and facilities and rooms had all the amenities, albeit they were small. Staff were friendly and helpful and there were a wide range of stores, restaraunts and druggists etc. in the immediate area. The tram was within easy walking distance to take you anywhere on this peninsula or across the golden horn to the main city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small elevators and rooms, hard mattress, air conditioning blowing right at you all night long”
Reviews.Author: kasiem
Reviews.Content: The good thing about this hotel is the location - you are within walking distance of the Grand Bazaar and dozens of restaurants. The rooms, however, are not at all comfortable. The beds are hard twin size cots with a thin blanket and rock hard pillow. While this is bad, the worst part was air conditioning that had only two settings - freezing cold or off. Since the unit was installed to blow directly at the beds, and the blanket was sheet-weight, I slept in a sweater, sweat pants and socks. Even bundled up, it was too cold. When we turned the air off, it was stiffling hot....no in between seemed possible. If you want to sleep well during the summer, I'd choose somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “great location, within walking distance to most attractions”
Reviews.Author: betsy80
Reviews.Content: It is within walking distance to the Grand Bazaar, only 10-15 minutes, and about same distance to the Suleymaniye Mosque and the Aqueduct; 30 minutes to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia. Only 5 minutes to the tram line. There is a very nice bakery close-by, and a very nice place for kabob, located on the other side of the main street. The hotel is on a side street. When you leave the hotel you always make a left, that will take you to the main street. About 500 feet, I think. I just love the location of the hotel, not too far from the airport. It is pretty clean, but rooms are small, yet adequate. Don't rely on the hotel clerk to arrange the airport transfer for you. It is cheaper to go to the airport transfer.com yourself. they charge 20 euro while the hotel arrangement will cost you 45 USD.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Attention to Solo Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Skyambler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very convenient location, however, I did not feel completely appreciated or accepted as a guest here. I stayed here twice and both times I was given unclean rooms. I had to ask them to remove the rugs that were in the bath that was so moldy and filthy. The AC was not allowed to be turned on since they felt it was too cold for it. Being from Chicago, to me 88F was too hot. I saw the reception staff treat people better when they were couples or families or of a lighter variation of skins. I also noticed mumbling several times when they saw me approach. The food was plentiful, but only a few foods were palatable. The breakfast bar omelets were great, the waiters were usually very friendly and unprejudiced. The Internet was erratic and even when complained it was never remedied throughout my stay of about a week combined. The hotel also has great amenities in the Spa below, jacuzzi, Turkish bath (hamam), swimming, and massages. I was also not happy with their pricing practices. The massages are way over-priced for Turkey. I would not return to Istanbul and stay at this hotel and do not recommend this hotel for solo travelers and those with darker shades of skin.

Reviews.Title: “Mosaic Hotel has it all!”
Reviews.Author: bwetter
Reviews.Content: We stayed on 2 different occasions and had a great experience both times. Friendly staff, very nice rooms and great breakfast. First class all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cozy hotel but far from taksim”
Reviews.Author: rezaghgh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Laleli area where most of wholesalers are there. The hotel it self is very clean,Cozy and comfortable. Room services and cleaning is regulare and perfect. The buffet breakfast has a wide selection and delicious foods. for natural juices you have to pay 5TL for a glass of orange juice but other drinkings are free.Rooms equipped by safe deposit boxes the Sauna , turkish bath,swimming pool and jaccuzi are perfect but the lady for allowing to use the items are not helpful and should learn how to behave with guests. rooms and bath room is quite small but clean. All in all if it is not matter for you to be far from Taksim and Istiklal Caddesi it is the right selection becuase the hotel is very clean and new otherwise I recommen to accomodate in a hotel in vicinity of Taksim square

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: gsfg5007
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mosaic is located in a great area with many shops, cafes, bars, and entertainment and close the Istanbul's main sightseeing area. The rooms were very clean and modern with all the necessary amenities and the food was also good. The bathroom was very small however and I had a hard time getting in and out of it. You have to pay for the internet here as well and also they request your passport to make a copy for their records so don't be surprised (they do give it back :). I would suggest making a copy beforehand and just giving them the copy. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home! A hidden jewel of Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: volcano_rush
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights at the Mosaic Hotel and this is our review of our experience: Great service from the moment we walked in! We received a very helpful & warm welcome from 'Arzu' at the reception desk - she even gave us a choice between two rooms! All the staff were extremely helpful and tended to our every request, whether that was at breakfast, in the leisure centre or anything to do with room service. They always gave us tips and directions to eating places of our taste; like Pizza hut & Domino's Pizza & helped improve our knowledge of transport links like the Tramway & City Buses. We stayed in a twin room on the 3rd floor (No. 302) the lift was right outside and was really quiet. The room was in fantastic order and the en-suite was in top condition; with everything working as new! The shower was lovely & warm. The room had an LCD tv (with BBC World service), air con and all the nice extras! Our room had fantastic signal strength to the free Hi-speed wireless internet service; which was a life saver during the Iceland Volcano disaster. It allowed us to keep in touch with all airline, airport and embassy websites at any time of the day or night - avoiding huge phone call bills to these establishments from a hotel phone! Our laptop was a life-saver and is a â€˜must-takeâ€™ item. The roof terrace was a popular spot for us twice a day â€“ once at midday and then late at night! It had a wooden swing which was so relaxing we often fell asleep! With uninterrupted 360 degree views of Istanbul, it definitely is one of the tallest Hotels in the area. The indoor fitness & leisure centre had all the new gym equipment and great staff to help you out. The pool, jacuzzi, sauna & turkish baths were awesome and immaculately clean â€“ like they were brand new! My 4 year old daughter & I used the swimming pool every single day â€“ which is made available to guests from 12 to 6pm. The Mosaic Hotel is conveniently located in the heart of the old city and is close to all the transport links and pedestrian routes - getting you to all the attractions in no time. I advise checking out Google Earth to plan your trip as it has the location of the hotel saved if you search for it & places of interest nearby. As well as having a look at the Istanbul transport maps before you go; such as tram, train & metro routes - just Google it. The Suleymaniye Mosque is only 0.6 km (10 min walk) & Grand Bazaar is also only 0.6 km (10 min walk). The nearest tram stop is Laleli-University Stop (0.35 km, only 5mins walk). The cost is only 1.5 lira (only 43 pence UK money) and each journey allows you to ride as long as you want one-way! That means you can travel 10 stops to Kabatas in 20 mins. This gets you near to Taksim, the new city & the well-known Taksim Square with a Pizza Hut! We loved Istanbul & all the Historical buildings and museums. As a Muslim family; the highlights were all the mosques and islamic architecture like Suleymaniye mosque, Sultanahmet mosque (The Blue Mosque), Beyazit Mosque & Topkapi Palace with the Islamic relics of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and his Companions. We also travelled to Mini Turkey (MiniaTurk) which is a park full of scale models of famous buildings from all around Turkey & a few famous ones from Jerusalem. The Grand Bazaar was an exciting experience with amazing things to buy and admire. And it's great for those who love to haggle and knock down the price on everything, like my Mrs & me! There was also a bazaar around the side of The Blue Mosque (called Arasta bazaar) which is a must-see! The only thing we didn't like was the Turkish food...such as donners, fried fish and meat dishes. With no Pakistani restaurants anywhere around, we certainly missed our traditional cuisine. Instead we stuck to Pizzas & fries. Our best experience (of price and quality) would be to recommend Domino's Pizza in Aksaray. Itâ€™s a 15-20min walk in a straight direction away from the tourist sites or you can catch the tram & get off at the 'Heseki' stop. Another thing to be keen about is the money exchange rates. Money Exchanges are called 'Doviz' and the most profitable one was behind the Laleli-University tram stop which gave a rate of 2.285 Lira to 1 UK pound. There are two there, but the one slightly further up, nearer to the Kent Hotel gave the best rate by far! Anyway, feel free to contact me for anymore advice...

Reviews.Title: “Downtown location, close to light rail”
Reviews.Author: TravelerDon
Reviews.Content: Located in the shopping district, easy access to points of interest by light rail or walking. Good breakfast buffet, but the second morning there was no coffee and no attempt to make coffee. No juice either.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay with good location”
Reviews.Author: LongNosedGeneral
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located in the middle of the city, within walking distance of the Grand Bazaar and other central attractions. Clean and friendly place, deserts on the dinner buffet were wonderful! All breakfast and dinner buffets consisted of Turkish style foods, and considering we were tourists in Turkey this was a great introduction to the tastes of the country. If you are not ready to be too adventurous, not to worry, the selection is wide enough that you will be sure to find something pleasing. The surrounding area is also dotted with large and small eateries that should satisfy. We only stayed there for two nights with Gate1Tours, would not hesitate to use the hotel again. The 4 star value rating is approximate since it was part of the package tour.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was great but don't buy anything at Daphnes as they charge through the roof - Â£5.00 for a cup of Nescafe”
Reviews.Author: JaybersB73
Reviews.Content: Hotel fantastic - really good location and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotels”
Reviews.Author: IK9
Reviews.Content: Stay here - really nice hotel. Very friendly. We messed up with our bookings and they managed to fit half of us in with a free upgrade too. Manager Oygun really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice, great stay”
Reviews.Author: danielle1012
Reviews.Content: I stayed there when I went to Istanbul before leaving to Antalya and back; the hotel was just renovated everything was clean, tidy and nice. Beautiful rooms with big TV Screens right on the wall. it is very well placed, a short walk and you discover Istanbul. the breakfast was good, many varieties and tasteful youghurt!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Modern”
Reviews.Author: addicted2travel3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mosaic Hotel in Istanbul while on a group tour with Gate1. The hotel was only recently opened and, as such, everything was modern and clean. The staff was responsive and pleasant and the location was great - it was within walking distance to the Grand Bazaar which I loved. The breakfast buffet was adequate - various cheeses, olives, juices, an omelet making station and different breads were offered each morning. I did find the bathroom to be very, very small. Also, I wonder about the construction quality of the hotel. Even though this is a newly opened hotel, there were already numerous cracks in the walls, the handheld shower head was already broken, and the drain in the shower did not function properly. Overall I realIy enjoyed my stay at the Mosaic and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean, modern accomodation that is also conveniently located to tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New, Beautiful, BUT working out the kinks...”
Reviews.Author: Al-Burj
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel twice in March, 2008. We were on a guided bus tour with Gate 1 Travel and stayed here at the beginning, and again at the end, of the tour. When we arrived in mid-March the hotel had JUST opened and they were putting the finishing touches on it. The hotel is BEAUTIFUL and brand new. It is in the old part of Istanbul so the roads to it are quite narrow, but the big tour bus did manage to get us to the front of the hotel. The staff was very friendly and spoke English. The rooms were very nice too, small by American standards, but well appointed as you can see from the pictures. The rooms have those card readers inside, so there is only power when you put your room card in the slot. Also the hallways have motion detecting lights, which is cool, unless you are standing in front of the two pretty (but small) elevators and the light shuts off while you are standing there. There is a restaurant in the hotel where we had breakfast and dinner and both were very good. The basement of the hotel does have a sauna and small gym but I didn't get a chance to try them. The hotel is a short walk to the Tram line, the Leila Universite stop. It is also walking distance to the Grand Bazaar. If you leave and plan to take a taxi back to the hotel MAKE SURE to get a card from the front desk. The card has the hotel's address on one side and a MAP of the hotel's location on the other. Being a new hotel no taxi (taksi in Turkish!) knew where it was and the card was very helpful. There is an internet cafe near by and lots of small stores, restaurants, cafes that cater to the college crowd. Note that the Turkish computer keyboard is VERY different than the English "qwerty" keyboard. The hotel did have wifi, but see below. The Hotel is NEW and there were still some problems that would crop up. For instance for a little while if you called the desk from your room to request a wake-up call, their computer would give them the wrong room number. The second time we were there the shower leaked from under the marble bar beneath the doors, basically from the base. Also, when we returned our tour bus arrived at 5:30 pm, and apparently they had allowed a pervious tour group to check out at 5 pm, leaving only 30 minutes to prepare 40 odd rooms! The hotel had wifi throughout, but only the wifi from the lobby would work. This was frustrating as the signal was strong in the room and entering the (front desk supplied) password would seem to work, but it wouldn't. Nobody in our tour group was ever able to connect from their rooms, just the lobby. There are a few other small things, but they were all because the hotel is new and I'm assuming by now those issues have been resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: queeni1129
Reviews.Content: We were starting our honeymoon in Istanbul and stayed here for 3 days. The room served it's purpose and it was an okay stay. It's a bit shabby, but we spent most of our time outside of the room exploring the city. The double bed was 2 twins pushed together, flat/hard typical European beds. The bathroom was clean, but it was a challenge stepping in/out of the tub at 5'1". Breakfast was provided every morning and it was okay. Most of the guests were Eastern European or Arabic. There was usually one front desk person that could speak English. The surrounding neighborhood definitely catered to Eastern Europeans based on the shops. Our driver from the airport warned us that the area was not safe at night due to the clubs in the area. So, we didn't explore much at night. Once we got our bearings, we were able to walk to the Blue Mosque area, which is where I would recommend staying since there are so many restaurants to choose from. There was only one sidewalk cafe near our hotel. Grand Bazaar is in walking distance as well, but be prepared to be ripped off. Overall, it was an okay stay, but would not stay here again just due to location and lack of restaurants in the area.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Mosaic
HotelInfo.Address: Vidinli Tevfik Pasa Cad No 21 | Vezneciler, Istanbul 34490, Turkey
